page.title: 08MINERS' STRIKE
page.content:
Before the recent mining dispute there was an air of prosperity and wealth in the area, shops were thriving and businesses were expanding, but during the dispute many had to close down.
Collections were made all over the country to buy food for miner's families. Money was sent from abroad, W.Germany, France etc. At Christmas, 9 months into the strike there was an air of depression, parents were having to tell young children that Santa was not coming this year.
At school the children of miners were supplied with free meals.Although nothing was ever said,I always felt that others were noticing that we were receiving charity.
